numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The top income bracket has the highest chance of admission to elite colleges.
2. This chance is higher than the chance for other income brackets by a large margin.
3. If a student has no legacy status then the student is much less likely to be admitted to a prestigious college.

4. If a student has no legacy boost and the student is in the 50th income percentile to the 85th income percentile then the student is less likely to be admitted than a student in a lower income bracket.
5. I wonder about reasons why wealthier applicants are more likely to be admitted.
6. I wonder whether colleges admit wealthier applicants because colleges expect more money from them.
7. I wonder why a legacy boost exists.
8. I wonder whether this trend continues at less prestigious colleges.
9. College admissions statistics will be important to me in the next few years.
10. College admissions statistics will be important to many people in my community in the next few years.
11. Many people in my community plan to go to college in the next few years.
12. These trends are concerning to many people in my community.
13. Many people in my community have no legacy status at any prestigious college.
14. If a person has no legacy status then the person's chance of admission decreases if the person applies to a prestigious college.
15. Most people in my area are middle class.
16. If a person is middle class then the person's chance of admission to a prestigious program decreases according to the graph.
17. The headline is: Prestigious College Admissions: an Exhibit of Plenitude and Legacy.
